items.question: John Dewey, Rousseau, Pestallozi and Froebel have greatly influenced the development of:
Which is NOT a component of the curriculum?
The actual development of objectives of the lesson plan is made possible through the series of:
The following are the criteria in the selection of subject matter except one. What is the exception?
The methods convert the written curriculum to instruction. Which of the following is a helpful guide in its selection?

choices.text: Teaching methods are means to achieve the end.
There is no single best teaching method.
Flexibility is not a consideration in the use of the teaching method.
Learning styles must be considered in the choice of a teaching method.

items.question: Which of the following approaches considered the learner as an active agent who builds personal understanding of their experiences?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a good curriculum?

choices.text: The curriculum is a complex of details.

items.question: One of the statements below is true. Which is true?

choices.text: The teaching and learning that takes is not influenced by the location of the community.
The location of the community does not affect teaching and learning
The teaching and learning that takes place in the school is affected by the community where it is situated
School performance cannot be linked with the community

items.question: In curriculum development, if you intend to put more importance in developing the learner's mind and spirit, what philosophical belief will you consider?
Curriculum dimension that is unplanned and implicit but its instructional effects are evident in the students' behavior, values and disposition.
The concept that includes planning, organization, implementation and evaluation.
The HOW in teaching refers to instruction, what does WHAT refer to?
The public elementary schools are using the curriculum that involves integration of social studies, music arts and PE on longer time blocks, what is the design problem?
In this period of Philippine history, the curriculum used to have terminated English as the medium of instruction.
A concept in curriculum which aims to provide learners with the needed skills in this ever-changing world.
Which of the following statement is NOT true about the subject-centered curriculum?

choices.text: The main task is mastery of learning
The teacher has the full control of the classroom activities
It covers more content in a short period of time
There is a high level of cooperative interaction

items.question: The following statements are criteria for offering curriculum that is experienced-centered, except:

choices.text: It should emphasize teaching facts and knowledge
It should be used with high level of cooperative interactions
It is primarily based on learners's needs, ability and interest
It should promote the use of active and dynamic process to improve learning

items.question: Mr. Cruz idea of curriculum leans heavily on being a cognitive process. Which of the following statements holds true to this conception of curriculum?

choices.text: Aims to make learning efficient and systematic
Develops skills in analysis, deduction and speculation
Considers largely the full development of lerners
Its content is sourced from the different academic and discipline sources

items.question: One of the factors in curriculum planning which concerns in identifying the required resources and the estimation of expenditure and revenue is
The following are the characteristics of the experience centered curriculum except:

choices.text: Education is a means to develop individual socially creative
The emphasis is on facts and knowledge for future application
Emphasizes the total growth and development of the learners
Cooperative control by learners, parents, and teachers

items.question: What pattern of organizing content/subject matter will be used if science subject is enriching by identifying related concepts in mathematics?
It is the dimension of curriculum design when you connect the lesson learned in one subject area to a related content in another subject area.

One type of curriculum design under the subject-centered design models in  which the subject's geography, economics, political science, anthropology and history are focused into one subject called social studies.
It is the process which curricula are used in the school and cosidered as the instructional phase of curriculum development process.
Level of curriculum in which the curriculum is perceived and experienced by each student and may vary among learners because of individual differences
How is Values Education offered in the National Secondary Education Curriculum?

choices.text: Integrated with Technology and Home Economics

items.question: The NSEC orients secondary education to:

If curriculum is defined following the traditional approach, which feature(s) apply(ies)?
    I. The aims of the curriculum are set by professional and experts.
   II. Interested groups (teachers, students, communities) are assumed to agree with the aims of the curriculum.
   III. Consensus building is not necessary

choices.text: providing opportunities for them to help the slow learners
providing opportunities for them to help the slow learners

items.question: Operation "Return to Basics" was launched by the Dept. of Education Culture ans Sports NOT only to upgrade pupil achievement but also to:

choices.text: Serve as basis for learning continuum

items.question: The main contribution of Arroyo administration in education is Republic Act No. 9155. This provision:

choices.text: Established the study now pay later plan

items.question: Which of the following are the basic components of the curriculum design?
Which of the following is the most important component of educational reform?

choices.text: Implementing a better curriculum for students
Allowing the students to participate more in extracurricular activities
Involving parents in the education for their children

items.question: All subjects in the Philippine Elementary and Secondary School are expected to be taught using the integrated approach. This came about as a result of the implementation of:

He used religion to make education universal. One of his ideas was to make elementary education compulsory.
Bilingual Education is best defined as:

choices.text: Using two languages in teaching the same subject
Using English and translating it into Filipino
Using the two languages separately in identified subject
Using Filipino or the local dialect instead of English

items.question: A free public school system was established in the Philip[pines by Act No 74. Which body passed this law?

choices.text: The soldiers who doubled the success of the public educational system in the Philippines
The first American teacher recruits who helped establish the public educational system in the Philippines

items.question: On which constitutional provision is the partial integration of capable deaf and blind students in the classroom based? The provision on:

choices.text: Creating scholarship for poor and deserving students

choices.text: Provide knowledge and develop skills, attitudes, values essential to personal development and necessary for living in and contributing to a developing and changing world.

Promote and intensify knowledge, identification with and love for the nation and the people to which the develop orientation to the world of work and prepare the learner to engage in honest and gainful work.

The understanding by design curricular approach, the first consideration is about

What educational philosophy does she consider if her major concern is to give the child's freedom to choose what to learn and believe, as she allows them to set their own identities and standards. What philosophy will you consider?

   I. Learners
   II. Society

   IV. Subject Matter

choices.text: Playing is important in the child's cognitive development
Playing is good form of exercise
Playing makes learning a pleasurable experiencne

items.question: Secondary school competencies in programming and fostering the learning process are classified as program, generic, and specific. Program competencies refer to the over-all competencies which should be the trusts of lessons/ programs for first to fourth year, the general competencies refers to the knowledge and information, skills, values and attitudes which need immediate and observable learning behavioral outcomes, hence, must be well defined, achieved, and realized based on the needs of the learners resources of the school and the nature of the society. How can the teacher succeed in achieving the goals of each curriculum which she/he handles in the secondary level?

choices.text: He/she must be able to pass the LET
He/she must be a degree holder
He/she must be familiar with types of competencies in the curriculum level he/she handles
Not only has he/she known all the types of competencies developed for secondary level but also to distunguish which competencies should be realized

items.question: What is the main concern of the spiraling of a curriculum?

choices.text: Horizontal articlation among the subjects in a grade level
Vertical articulation of a given subject across grade level
incorporating governmental thrust and societal concerns

items.question: The construction of the curriculum in a modern school should be

choices.text: Planned by the principal, supervisors, and superintendents and teachers
Decide by the DepEd and followed by all schools in the country
Planned cooperatively by experienced persons and students
Built based on books available in schools

items.question: If we aim to produce globally competitive graduates, the Philippines education should give minor emphasis on ____

choices.text: Integrate sustainable development on the curriculum
Sustainable development is not within the grasp of the students

items.question: among the following, which best describe the implication of EFA for schools?

choices.text: Making educational reform in exclusive schools

choices.text: The learner is placed at the center.
